Panjab Notes and Queries
EDITOR’S OFFICE
AMBÁLÁ, PANJÁB, INDIA Dated 19-9-1884
div.p: Thus after 25th Aug. I am really at Simla in the hillsShimla (früher Simla) ist die Hauptstadt des nordindischen Bundesstaats Himachal Pradesh, der in den Ausläufern des Himalaya-Gebirges liegt. for a month trying to recover from an attack of optic neuralgia brought on by overwork, which as you may imagine, is a chronic complaint with me!

You are quite welcome to keep my M.S.S. & use them at your leisure & pray do not work at them too soon after your illness in order to send them back to me
soon. I am in no hurry to get them back again. I am glad to think you will find them of use.
You will see that we make cites of corrupt English etc in my paper from time to time & I hope you will find them useful.

I see the 1st volume of my Legends of the Panjab
Captain Richard Carnac Temple, The Legens of the Panjâb. Vol., 1, Bombay: Education Society's Press London: Trübner, [1884].
is highly spoken of in England & France which is gratifying but I wish it sold better, at present I am a much heavier loser over the sale than I can afford. I have
commenced vol II but unless the sale increases a good deal I shall have to stop the other volumes which will be a disappointment as the material is all new.

I am editing the late Dr Fallon‘s Hindustani Proverbs (12,500) for his executers. One part is out.Samuel W. Fallon,
Hindustani-English Dictionary of idioms and proverbs
, Banares: Medical Hall Press, 1886.
The Notes & Queries is getting on very well indeed, I am glad to say, I am doubling the size of it next month.

The notices are out that Mr Fleet,
John Faithful Fleet (1847-1917), Historiker, Epigraphiker u. Linguist, engl. Beamter im indischen öffentlichen Dienst. the Epigraphist, & myself are to edit the Indian Antiquary from next January.
The Indian Antiquary. A journal of oriental research in archaeology, history, literature, language, philosophy, religion, folklore, &c, &c, ersch. Zw. 1872 u. 1933. Der erste Hrsg.
James Burgess mußte wegen ernster Augenprobleme sein Amt aufgeben. I hope it will be as successful in the hands as in those of Dr Burgess
